column4: I have a dual boot system with a windows partition on top of my ubuntu install and I was just wondering what the best way was to go about formatting one of the partitions?
you can do a simple sudo mkfs.ext3 or whatever fstype so mkfs.ext3 /dev/sdc2 or whatever but make really really sure the partition you format
but formatting the windows partition won't break GRUB? I am going to reinstall windows but I want to make sure my nix partition is still intact.
no grub is installed to the hd mbr and it loads /boot/grub on the ubuntu partition you only need to maintain /boot partitition and mbr
now if you format the ubuntu partition this will result in badness
ok, so no matter how I format the windows partition GRUB should remain intact and it should be fine to simply reinstall windows and GRUB should recognize it and run as usual?
yep
so grub exists on mbr which the system loads then grub loads the stuff in /boot as long as the partition number remains the same youre fine
alright, is it possible to format the windows partition from inside ubuntu?
yes very easy
well I am very glad that I went with the dual boot config, alright so what is the command to format C: from inside ubuntu? (windows is C: simply due to convention)
you can do a sudo fdisk -l to list all partitions then a sudo mkfs.ext3 /dev/partitionnumber where partitionnumber might be sda3 or whatever
that is the command line option there are tools in the gui too
I generally prefer the terminal route as GUI is more buggy. Ok so my NTFS windows partition is the /dev/sda1 ...
but I want to format it for NTFS right?
depends. what do you want to use it for?
this is the windows part... so it needs to be NTFS I am pretty sure ... or technically FAT32. heh.
ah i wouldnt format ntfs for windows with a linux tool if i knew of one.  what i would do is use the windows install cd to do it. sorry didnt know you wanted ntfs
ok so the windows install CD/DVD should be able to format the windows partition on its own anyway if I boot from CD correct?
yeah just dont let it use the whole hd and reformat everything
and that way it will do NTFS. Yeah, I won't. I wish there was a way to get a common partition for storage that would read in both OSes.
you can use fat32 that is fine for a media share
you can format fat32 in ubuntu.
alright, well thanks a lot. I am going to finish backing stuff up on DVD and then attempt the format. Thanks again.
